territory.notes: An Irish Republic was declared by revolutionaries in 1919. Although it came to control much of the island of Ireland by 1922 it was never formally recognized by the United Kingdom. The Anglo-Irish Treaty created the Irish Free State in December 1922, an independent nation with commonwealth status. The United States recognized the Irish Free State in 1924. A new constitution which changed the name of the nation from ‘Irish Free State’ to ‘Ireland’ (‘Éire’ in Gaelic) took effect on December 29, 1937. In 1949, through the Republic of Ireland Act, Ireland severed its ties to the commonwealth and the British monarchy and declared that the state ‘shall be described as the Republic of Ireland.’ This distinction may have been adopted in part because the government of the United Kingdom objected to referring to the nation in question as ‘Ireland’ given the distinction between the island and the polities situated upon it.
